intro: Lindelofia longiflora var. levingei, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lindelofia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are elongated and narrow, with a distinctively veined structure. The flowers are usually white or pale blue, blooming in late spring to early summer.
